title: Retail Sales Jump By Biggest Amount In 8 Months
teaser: The seasonally adjusted 0.7 percent increase exceeded economists' expectations and comes after some bleak Black Friday sales reports.
contentencoded:
The Commerce Department reported today that retail sales jumped by the biggest amount in eight months during the month of November.

The seasonally adjusted 0.7 percent increase exceeded economists’ expectations. This comes after some bleak Black Friday sales reports and concern about the holiday shopping season.

CBS business analyst Jill Schlesinger spoke to Here & Now‘s Jeremy Hobson about the November retail sales report.

Guest

  • Jill Schlesinger, CBS News business analyst. She tweets @jillonthemoney.
